00014 /******************************************************************************************************************************
00015  *                                      ValueType
00016  ******************************************************************************************************************************/
00017 
00018 template<size_t nBits>
00019 struct ValueType {
00020     uint64_t defbits;           
00023     ValueType(): defbits(0) {}
00024 
00026     ValueType(uint64_t n) /*implicit*/ {
00027         defbits = n & IntegerOps::GenMask<uint64_t, nBits>::value;
00028     }
00029 
00031     template<size_t Len>
00032     ValueType(const ValueType<Len> &other) {
00033         defbits = other.defbits & IntegerOps::GenMask<uint64_t, nBits>::value; // make sure high-order bits are zeroed out
00034     }
00035 
00037     static ValueType<nBits> defined() { return ValueType<nBits>((uint64_t)(-1)); }
00038 
00040     static ValueType<nBits> undefined() { return ValueType<nBits>(0); }
00041 
00043     bool is_defined() const {
00044         return 0 == (~defbits & IntegerOps::GenMask<uint64_t, nBits>::value);
00045     }
00046 
00048     bool is_undefined() const {
00049         return !is_defined();
00050     }
00051 
00054     uint64_t known_value() const {
00055         return defbits;
00056     }
00057 
00059     void print(std::ostream &o) const {
00060         if (is_defined()) {                     // all bits defined
00061             o <<"defined";
00062         } else if (0==defbits) {                // all bits undefined
00063             o <<"undefined";
00064         } else {                                // some defined, some undefined (show the mask)
00065             int nnibbles = (nBits+3)/4;
00066             char buf[128];
00067             snprintf(buf, sizeof buf, "0x%0*"PRIx64, nnibbles, defbits);
00068             o <<buf;
00069         }
00070     }
00071 };
00072 
00073 template<size_t nBits>
00074 std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream &o, const ValueType<nBits> &e)
00075 {
00076     e.print(o);
00077     return o;
00078 }

00084 struct State {
00085     static const size_t n_gprs = 8;             
00086     static const size_t n_segregs = 6;          
00088     ValueType<32> ip;
00089     ValueType<32> gpr[n_gprs];
00090     ValueType<16> segreg[n_segregs];
00091     ValueType<32> flags;
00092 
00094     void clear() {
00095         *this = State();
00096     }
00097 
00099     void merge(const State&);
00100 
00102     bool equal_registers(const State&) const;
00103 
00106     void print(std::ostream&) const;
00107     friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream &o, const State &state) {
00108         state.print(o);
00109         return o;
00110     }
00112 };

00118 class Policy {

00127     struct Exception {
00128         Exception(const std::string &mesg): mesg(mesg) {}
00129         friend std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream &o, const Exception &e) {
00130             o <<"FindRegisterDefs exception: " <<e.mesg;
00131             return o;
00132         }
00133         std::string mesg;
00134     };

00195     template<size_t FromLen, size_t ToLen>
00196     ValueType<ToLen> signExtend(const ValueType<FromLen> &a) const {
00197         return IntegerOps::signExtend<FromLen, ToLen>(a.defbits);
00198     }
00199 
00202     template <size_t BeginAt, size_t EndAt, size_t Len>
00203     ValueType<EndAt-BeginAt> extract(const ValueType<Len> &a) const {
00204         if (0==BeginAt) return ValueType<EndAt-BeginAt>(a);
00205         return (a.defbits >> BeginAt) & IntegerOps::GenMask<uint64_t, EndAt-BeginAt>::value;
00206     }
00207 
00210     template <size_t FromLen, size_t ToLen>
00211     ValueType<ToLen> unsignedExtend(const ValueType<FromLen> &a) const {
00212         uint64_t newbits = IntegerOps::GenMask<uint64_t, ToLen>::value & ~IntegerOps::GenMask<uint64_t, FromLen>::value;
00213         return a.defbits | newbits; // all new bits are defined (i.e., they would be set to zero if we were tracking values)
00214     }

00304     /*************************************************************************************************************************
00305      * Functions invoked by the X86InstructionSemantics class for data access operations

00309     const RegisterDescriptor& findRegister(const std::string &regname, size_t nbits=0) {
00310         const RegisterDescriptor *reg = get_register_dictionary()->lookup(regname);
00311         if (!reg) {
00312             std::ostringstream ss;
00313             ss <<"Invalid register: \"" <<regname <<"\"";
00314             throw Exception(ss.str());
00315         }
00316         if (nbits>0 && reg->get_nbits()!=nbits) {
00317             std::ostringstream ss;
00318             ss <<"Invalid " <<nbits <<"-bit register: \"" <<regname <<"\" is "
00319                <<reg->get_nbits() <<" " <<(1==reg->get_nbits()?"byte":"bytes");
00320             throw Exception(ss.str());
00321         }
00322         return *reg;
00323     }
00324 
00326     template<size_t Len/*bits*/>
00327     ValueType<Len> readRegister(const char *regname) {
00328         return readRegister<Len>(findRegister(regname, Len));
00329     }
00330 
00332     template<size_t Len/*bits*/>
00333     void writeRegister(const char *regname, const ValueType<Len> &value) {
00334         writeRegister<Len>(findRegister(regname, Len), value);
00335     }
00336 
00338     template<size_t Len>
00339     ValueType<Len> readRegister(const RegisterDescriptor &reg) {
00340         switch (Len) {
00341             case 1: {
00342                 // Only FLAGS/EFLAGS bits have a size of one.  Other registers cannot be accessed at this granularity.
00343                 if (reg.get_major()!=x86_regclass_flags)
00344                     throw Exception("bit access only valid for FLAGS/EFLAGS register");
00345                 if (reg.get_minor()!=0 || reg.get_offset()>=32)
00346                     throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00347                 if (reg.get_nbits()!=1)
00348                     throw Exception("semantic policy supports only single-bit flags");
00349                 uint64_t mask = (uint64_t)1 << reg.get_offset();
00350                 rdundef.flags.defbits |= ~cur_state.flags.defbits & mask;
00351                 uint64_t retval = (cur_state.flags.defbits & mask) >> reg.get_offset();
00352                 return retval;
00353             }
00354 
00355             case 8: {
00356                 // Only general-purpose registers can be accessed at a byte granularity, and we can access only the low-order
00357                 // byte or the next higher byte.  For instance, "al" and "ah" registers.
00358                 if (reg.get_major()!=x86_regclass_gpr)
00359                     throw Exception("byte access only valid for general purpose registers");
00360                 if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.n_gprs)
00361                     throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00362                 assert(reg.get_nbits()==8); // we had better be asking for a one-byte register (e.g., "ah", not "ax")
00363                 switch (reg.get_offset()) {
00364                     case 0:
00365                         rdundef.gpr[reg.get_minor()].defbits |= ~cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()].defbits & 0x000000ff;
00366                         return extract<0, Len>(cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()]);
00367                     case 8:
00368                         rdundef.gpr[reg.get_minor()].defbits |= ~cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()].defbits & 0x0000ff00;
00369                         return extract<8, 8+Len>(cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()]);
00370                     default:
00371                         throw Exception("invalid one-byte access offset");
00372                 }
00373             }
00374 
00375             case 16: {
00376                 if (reg.get_nbits()!=16)
00377                     throw Exception("invalid 2-byte register");
00378                 if (reg.get_offset()!=0)
00379                     throw Exception("policy does not support non-zero offsets for word granularity register access");
00380                 switch (reg.get_major()) {
00381                     case x86_regclass_segment:
00382                         if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.n_segregs)
00383                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00384                         rdundef.segreg[reg.get_minor()].defbits |= ~cur_state.segreg[reg.get_minor()].defbits & 0x0000ffff;
00385                         return unsignedExtend<16, Len>(cur_state.segreg[reg.get_minor()]);
00386                     case x86_regclass_gpr:
00387                         if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.n_gprs)
00388                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00389                         rdundef.gpr[reg.get_minor()].defbits |= ~cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()].defbits & 0x0000ffff;
00390                         return extract<0, Len>(cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()]);
00391                     case x86_regclass_flags:
00392                         if (reg.get_minor()!=0)
00393                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00394                         rdundef.flags.defbits |= ~cur_state.flags.defbits & 0x0000ffff;
00395                         return extract<0, Len>(cur_state.flags);
00396                     default:
00397                         throw Exception("word access not valid for this register type");
00398                 }
00399             }
00400 
00401             case 32: {
00402                 if (reg.get_offset()!=0)
00403                     throw Exception("policy does not support non-zero offsets for double word granularity register access");
00404                 switch (reg.get_major()) {
00405                     case x86_regclass_gpr:
00406                         if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.n_gprs)
00407                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00408                         rdundef.gpr[reg.get_minor()].defbits |= ~cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()].defbits & 0xffffffff;
00409                         return unsignedExtend<32, Len>(cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()]);
00410                     case x86_regclass_ip:
00411                         if (reg.get_minor()!=0)
00412                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00413                         rdundef.ip.defbits |= ~cur_state.ip.defbits & 0xffffffff;
00414                         return unsignedExtend<32, Len>(cur_state.ip.defbits);
00415                     case x86_regclass_segment:
00416                         if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.n_segregs || reg.get_nbits()!=16)
00417                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00418                         rdundef.segreg[reg.get_minor()].defbits |= ~cur_state.segreg[reg.get_minor()].defbits & 0x0000ffff;
00419                         return unsignedExtend<16, Len>(cur_state.segreg[reg.get_minor()]);
00420                     case x86_regclass_flags: {
00421                         if (reg.get_minor()!=0)
00422                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00423                         if (reg.get_nbits()!=32)
00424                             throw Exception("register is not 32 bits");
00425                         rdundef.flags.defbits |= ~cur_state.flags.defbits & 0xffffffff;
00426                         return cur_state.flags;
00427                     }
00428                     default:
00429                         throw Exception("double word access not valid for this register type");
00430                 }
00431             }
00432 
00433             default:
00434                 throw Exception("invalid register access width");
00435         }
00436     }
00437 
00439     template<size_t Len>
00440     void writeRegister(const RegisterDescriptor &reg, const ValueType<Len> &value) {
00441         switch (Len) {
00442             case 1: {
00443                 // Only FLAGS/EFLAGS bits have a size of one.  Other registers cannot be accessed at this granularity.
00444                 if (reg.get_major()!=x86_regclass_flags)
00445                     throw Exception("bit access only valid for FLAGS/EFLAGS register");
00446                 if (reg.get_minor()!=0 || reg.get_offset()>=32)
00447                     throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00448                 if (reg.get_nbits()!=1)
00449                     throw Exception("semantic policy supports only single-bit flags");
00450                 uint64_t mask = (uint64_t)1 << reg.get_offset();
00451                 cur_state.flags.defbits &= ~mask;
00452                 cur_state.flags.defbits |= (value.defbits << reg.get_offset()) & mask;
00453                 break;
00454             }
00455 
00456             case 8: {
00457                 // Only general purpose registers can be accessed at byte granularity, and only for offsets 0 and 8.
00458                 if (reg.get_major()!=x86_regclass_gpr)
00459                     throw Exception("byte access only valid for general purpose registers.");
00460                 if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.n_gprs)
00461                     throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00462                 assert(reg.get_nbits()==8); // we had better be asking for a one-byte register (e.g., "ah", not "ax")
00463                 switch (reg.get_offset()) {
00464                     case 0:
00465                         cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()] =
00466                             concat(signExtend<Len, 8>(value), extract<8, 32>(cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()])); // no-op extend
00467                         break;
00468                     case 8:
00469                         cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()] =
00470                             concat(extract<0, 8>(cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()]),
00471                                    concat(unsignedExtend<Len, 8>(value),
00472                                           extract<16, 32>(cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()])));
00473                         break;
00474                     default:
00475                         throw Exception("invalid byte access offset");
00476                 }
00477                 break;
00478             }
00479 
00480             case 16: {
00481                 if (reg.get_nbits()!=16)
00482                     throw Exception("invalid 2-byte register");
00483                 if (reg.get_offset()!=0)
00484                     throw Exception("policy does not support non-zero offsets for word granularity register access");
00485                 switch (reg.get_major()) {
00486                     case x86_regclass_segment:
00487                         if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.n_segregs)
00488                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00489                         cur_state.segreg[reg.get_minor()] = unsignedExtend<Len, 16>(value);
00490                         break;
00491                     case x86_regclass_gpr:
00492                         if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.n_gprs)
00493                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00494                         cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()] =
00495                             concat(unsignedExtend<Len, 16>(value),
00496                                    extract<16, 32>(cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()]));
00497                         break;
00498                     case x86_regclass_flags:
00499                         if (reg.get_minor()!=0)
00500                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00501                         cur_state.flags = unsignedExtend<0, 16>(value);
00502                         break;
00503                     default:
00504                         throw Exception("word access not valid for this register type");
00505                 }
00506                 break;
00507             }
00508 
00509             case 32: {
00510                 if (reg.get_offset()!=0)
00511                     throw Exception("policy does not support non-zero offsets for double word granularity register access");
00512                 switch (reg.get_major()) {
00513                     case x86_regclass_gpr:
00514                         if (reg.get_minor()>=cur_state.n_gprs)
00515                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00516                         cur_state.gpr[reg.get_minor()] = signExtend<Len, 32>(value);
00517                         break;
00518                     case x86_regclass_ip:
00519                         if (reg.get_minor()!=0)
00520                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00521                         cur_state.ip = unsignedExtend<Len, 32>(value);
00522                         break;
00523                     case x86_regclass_flags:
00524                         if (reg.get_minor()!=0)
00525                             throw Exception("register not implemented in semantic policy");
00526                         if (reg.get_nbits()!=32)
00527                             throw Exception("register is not 32 bits");
00528                         cur_state.flags = unsignedExtend<Len, 32>(value);
00529                         break;
00530                     default:
00531                         throw Exception("double word access not valid for this register type");
00532                 }
00533                 break;
00534             }
00535 
00536             default:
00537                 throw Exception("invalid register access width");
00538         }
00539     }

00552     /*************************************************************************************************************************
00553      * Functions invoked by the X86InstructionSemantics class for arithmetic operations
00554      *************************************************************************************************************************/
00555 
00559     template <size_t Len>
00560     ValueType<Len> add(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<Len> &b) const {
00561         uint64_t defbits = 0;
00562         for (size_t i=0; i<Len && 0!=(a.defbits & ((uint64_t)1<<i)) && 0!=(b.defbits & ((uint64_t)1<<i)); ++i)
00563             defbits |= (uint64_t)1<<i;
00564         return defbits;
00565     }
00566 
00581     template <size_t Len>
00582     ValueType<Len> addWithCarries(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<Len> &b, const ValueType<1> &c,
00583                                   ValueType<Len> &carry_out) const {
00584         if (0==c.defbits)
00585             return carry_out = ValueType<Len>::undefined();
00586 
00587         ValueType<Len> retval = add(a, b);
00588         carry_out = (retval.defbits << 1);
00589         return retval;
00590     }
00591 
00593     template <size_t Len>
00594     ValueType<Len> and_(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<Len> &b) const {
00595         return a.defbits & b.defbits; // result defined where both a and b are defined
00596     }
00597 
00599     template <size_t Len>
00600     ValueType<1> equalToZero(const ValueType<Len> &a) const {
00601         return a.is_defined() ? ValueType<1>::defined() : ValueType<1>::undefined();
00602     }

00605     template <size_t Len>
00606     ValueType<Len> invert(const ValueType<Len> &a) const {
00607         return a; // no change in defined bits
00608     }

00612     template<size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
00613     ValueType<Len1+Len2> concat(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
00614         return a.defbits | (b.defbits << Len1);
00615     }

00620     template <size_t Len>
00621     ValueType<Len> ite(const ValueType<1> &sel, const ValueType<Len> &ifTrue, const ValueType<Len> &ifFalse) const {
00622         return ifTrue.defbits & ifFalse.defbits;
00623     }

00640     template <size_t Len>
00641     ValueType<Len> negate(const ValueType<Len> &a) const {
00642         return add(invert(a), ValueType<Len>::defined());
00643     }

00648     ValueType<Len> or_(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<Len> &b) const {
00649         return a.defbits & b.defbits;

00666 
00670     template <size_t Len, size_t SALen>
00671     ValueType<Len> shiftLeft(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<SALen> &sa) const {
00672         uint64_t result = 0;
00673         for (size_t i=0; i<Len && 0!=(a.defbits & ((uint64_t)1<<i)); ++i)
00674             result |= (uint64_t)1 << i;
00675         return result;
00676     }
00677 
00681     template <size_t Len, size_t SALen>
00682     ValueType<Len> shiftRight(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<SALen> &sa) const {
00683         uint64_t result = 0;
00684         for (size_t i=Len+1; i>0 && 0!=(a.defbits & ((uint64_t)1<<(i-1))); --i)
00685             result |= (uint64_t)1 << (i-1);
00686         return result;
00687     }
00688 
00691     template <size_t Len, size_t SALen>
00692     ValueType<Len> shiftRightArithmetic(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<SALen> &sa) const {
00693         return shiftRight(a, sa);
00694     }
00695 
00697     template <size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
00698     ValueType<Len1> signedDivide(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
00699         // FIXME: could be made more precise, like signedMultiply()
00700         return a.is_defined() && b.is_defined() ? ValueType<Len1>::defined() : ValueType<Len1>::undefined();
00701     }
00702 
00704     template <size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
00705     ValueType<Len2> signedModulo(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
00706         return a.is_defined() && b.is_defined() ? ValueType<Len2>::defined() : ValueType<Len2>::undefined();
00707     }
00708 
00711     template <size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
00712     ValueType<Len1+Len2> signedMultiply(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
00713         size_t a_ndef = 0;
00714         if (a.is_defined()) {
00715             a_ndef = Len1+Len2;
00716         } else {
00717             while (a_ndef<Len1 && 0!=(a.defbits & ((uint64_t)1<<a_ndef)))
00718                 ++a_ndef;
00719         }
00720 
00721         size_t b_ndef = 0;
00722         if (b.is_defined()) {
00723             b_ndef = Len1+Len2;
00724         } else {
00725             while (b_ndef<Len1 && 0!=(b.defbits & ((uint64_t)1<<b_ndef)))
00726                 ++b_ndef;
00727         }
00728 
00729         uint64_t result_ndef = std::min(a_ndef, b_ndef);
00730         uint64_t result = ((uint64_t)1 << result_ndef) - 1;
00731         return result;
00732     }
00733 
00735     template <size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
00736     ValueType<Len1> unsignedDivide(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
00737         // FIXME: could be made more precise, like unsignedMultiply()
00738         return a.is_defined() && b.is_defined() ? ValueType<Len1>::defined() : ValueType<Len1>::undefined();
00739     }
00740 
00742     template <size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
00743     ValueType<Len2> unsignedModulo(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
00744         return a.is_defined() && b.is_defined() ? ValueType<Len2>::defined() : ValueType<Len2>::undefined();
00745     }
00746 
00748     template <size_t Len1, size_t Len2>
00749     ValueType<Len1+Len2> unsignedMultiply(const ValueType<Len1> &a, const ValueType<Len2> &b) const {
00750         size_t a_ndef = 0;
00751         if (a.is_defined()) {
00752             a_ndef = Len1+Len2;
00753         } else {
00754             while (a_ndef<Len1 && 0!=(a.defbits & ((uint64_t)1<<a_ndef)))
00755                 ++a_ndef;
00756         }
00757 
00758         size_t b_ndef = 0;
00759         if (b.is_defined()) {
00760             b_ndef = Len1+Len2;
00761         } else {
00762             while (b_ndef<Len1 && 0!=(b.defbits & ((uint64_t)1<<b_ndef)))
00763                 ++b_ndef;
00764         }
00765 
00766         uint64_t result_ndef = std::min(a_ndef, b_ndef);
00767         uint64_t result = ((uint64_t)1 << result_ndef) - 1;
00768         return result;
00769     }
00770 
00772     template <size_t Len>
00773     ValueType<Len> xor_(const ValueType<Len> &a, const ValueType<Len> &b) const {
00774         return a.defbits & b.defbits;
00775     }
00776 };
